Key Arguments: The submission argues that allowing authorities to determine 'truth' can lead to abuse of power and suppression of dissent.
Historical examples are cited to illustrate the dangers of controlling narratives, including references to Stalin, Lenin, and Mao.
The submission suggests that recent events demonstrate a suppression of diverse opinions and voices across various fields, including art, religion, politics, and science.
The author believes that the proposed legislation threatens democratic freedom and open speech.
Notable Quotes: There is no shortage of historical examples of the appalling abuse of power to the detriment of the masses when the prevailing ‘authorities’ get to determine what constitutes ‘truth’.
The recent suppression and coercion in which opinion, news, comedy, music, commerce, art and association has been curtailed over the last few years is astonishingly evident.
I am truly astonished that our ‘leaders’ are unable or unwilling to defend open and unreserved speech, which has been a fundamental and vital underpinning of democratic freedom in Australia.
